      • printProcessingTime

        public void printProcessingTime()

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Method that converts the input image to binary. If the input image is not grayscale and the FORCE flag is not set to true, then this will fail to convert. If the FORCE flag is set to true, this will also convert the input image to grayscale if needed.
        Specified by:
        execute in class ExecutionStep

      • rgbToInt

        private int rgbToInt(short red,
                     short green,
                     short blue)
        Method that converts a color from red, green, blue scheme to int. Assuming the image is a 24bit channel image, the alpha component is therefore null.
        Parameters:
        red - the red value
        green - the green value
        blue - the blue value
        Returns:
        int containing the all three elements (r, g, b) - i.e. rgb converted to integer

      • isGrayscale

        private boolean isGrayscale(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Method that checks if the input image is grayscale.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to check for grayscale
        Returns:
        boolean stating whether or not the image is grayscale

      • convertToGrayscale

        private void convertToGrayscale(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Method that converts the input image to grayscale. This uses the luminosity method - weighted average to account for human eye perception.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to convert to grayscale
